American Princes' second CD Less and Less  was, for me, almost a sexual experience. This indie rock band from Little Rock, Arkansas and their bluesy garage-rock sound is breathtaking in its intensity and emotional release. ItÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢s like making love outside in the pouring rain. And youÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢ll love every minute of it.

American Princes unique lyrical, vocal, and musical combinations create a sound that ranges from Kings of Leon to the Chili Peppers, Cream to Bowie. Less and Less is a triumph of talent and imagination. ItÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢s raw but cultivated, passionate yet intelligent, retro and cutting-edge rock with provocative blues undercurrents. I loved this album but not without exception.

It will have you singing along before you even know all the words. ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã…â€œYou & ThemÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚ï¿½ is beautifully acoustic with reverently sung poignant lyrics.

ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã…â€œBreaksÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚ï¿½ sounds like a nod to Chris Isaak. Soft, melodic bass lines and pulsating beats drive SladeÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢s intense, deep, sensual vocals to a wet, quivering, all but orgasmic brink.

It wasnÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢t true love however. ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã…â€œStolen BluesÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚ï¿½ sounds like the Clash with soft bits and I never warmed to it. And ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã…â€œTV Keeps Me UpÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚ï¿½ is a skiffle nightmare that is out of place on what is otherwise an excellent album.

This album feels like sex on a CD. Less and Less is a sensual, sexual, throbbing, rock & roll/ blues classic. And I think I may be in love.
